Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the PRRA officer err in rejecting the applicants' H&C application based on unreasonable findings?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants overstayed their visa after a failed refugee claim. They have family ties, establishment in Canada, and fear risks in Guyana.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: H&C application denied due to lack of unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application allowed; matter remanded for redetermination
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimants with pending sponsorship application
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada beyond authorized stay
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family ties, establishment in Canada, risk upon return to Guyana
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applies to H&C decisions; correctness for legal errors
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Unusual or disproportionate hardship, family ties, establishment, country conditions
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to H&C considerations and PRRA
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider pending sponsorship application
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Details of family relationships, residential and employment history, country condition reports
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) considerations under s.25(1)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Family ties in Canada, length of residence, integration, risks in Guyana
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Exemption from removal based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: PRRA officers must assess all relevant factors including potential sponsorship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: PRRA officer did not consider pending sponsorship application
Crimes.Outcome: Decision found unreasonable due to incomplete assessment; remitted for reconsideration
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential separation from family, reintegration challenges in Guyana
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed visa and were denied H&C exemption due to lack of unusual hardship
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 25(1) IRPA – failure to properly assess H&C factors
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Incomplete consideration of evidence regarding sponsorship
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: PRRA officer assessed most factors but omitted key element (sponsorship)
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No unusual hardship found, but omission of sponsorship renders decision unreasonable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to address material evidence (pending sponsorship)

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the PRRA officer err in rejecting the applicants' H&C application based on unreasonable findings?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants remained in Canada after removal order; claimed hardship due to family ties, establishment, and risks in Guyana
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: H&C application denied due to lack of unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application allowed; matter referred back for reassessment including sponsorship analysis
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimants with pending sponsorship application
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to depart Canada per removal order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family ties, establishment in Canada, risk upon return to Guyana
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applies to H&C decisions; correctness for legal errors
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Unusual or disproportionate hardship, family ties, establishment, country conditions

Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) considerations under s.25(1)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Family ties in Canada, length of residence, integration, risks in Guyana
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Exemption from removal based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: PRRA officers must assess all relevant factors including potential sponsorship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: PRRA officer did not consider pending sponsorship application
Crimes.Outcome: Decision found unreasonable due to incomplete assessment; remitted for reconsideration
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential separation from family, reintegration challenges in Guyana
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed their visa and were denied H&C exemption due to lack of unusual hardship
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 25(1) IRPA – failure to properly assess H&C factors
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Incomplete consideration of evidence regarding sponsorship
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – failed to comply with removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: PRRA officer assessed most factors but omitted key element (sponsorship)

Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to address material evidence (pending sponsorship)
